speaker: Hank
text: [_v.o._] So, Dr. Crane, I just don't know what to do about my weight.  I've tried diet after diet, from the "milkshakes three times a day" to that scary bald-headed lady on TV. Nothing seems to work.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hank, listen to me.  You've got to look inside yourself. There is a part of you that isn't being fed.

speaker: Hank
text: Well, it certainly isn't my butt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, I'm talking about your inner self.  What isn't being fed there?  Love, career, simple self-esteem?  There are deeper issues at work here.

speaker: Hank
text: So, so what do I do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd suggest extended therapy.  Please stay on the line, and my producer Roz will refer you to the help you need.  Roz, who's our next call?

speaker: Roz
text: We have someone on line one who disagrees with your advice to Hank.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, really? [_pushes button_] Hello, you're on the line.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_v.o._] Congratulations, Frasier, you've done it again.

speaker: Lilith
text: You've led another unsuspecting innocent down one of your dark, dead-end Freudian hallways.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith?

speaker: Lilith
text: Overeating is very simply a behavioral problem caused by negative reinforcement.  It can be cured quite readily by behavior modification.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, Seattle, we have a celebrity of sorts on the line.  This is my ex-wife, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: What do you mean by "celebrity?"

speaker: Frasier
text: [_darkly_] Oh, they know you. [_hits the cough button_] Roz, what exactly does "call screening" mean?

speaker: Roz
text: It means I get to put on the air the calls I want to hear.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_lets go of button_] Well, Lilith, what brings you to Seattle -- the constant rain?

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm here for a convention, and I happened to hear your voice on the radio.  I kept hoping you'd introduce Pearl Jam's latest hit, but much to my chagrin, you were doling out worthless little advice pellets from your psychiatric Pez dispenser.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess you'll be rushing off to your little convention now, and I suppose we'll just have to catch up on your next trip.

speaker: Lilith
text: Actually, I'm not doing anything for dinner tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Well, then you'll want to keep your dial tuned to 780 for Gil Chesterton's "Restaurant Beat."

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you ask her out to dinner, Dr. Crane?  _Frasier hits the cough button again and gives Roz a glare that would melt through lead.  She just grins at him.  He lets go of the button._

speaker: Frasier
text: What a wonderful idea! [_takes a piece of paper and a Magic Marker and starts writing_] And let me tell you why, Seattle. You see, even though our marriage was unsuccessful, Lilith and I are quite capable of conducting ourselves as adults, and even enjoying spending some time together, from time to time.  So, Lilith, seven at my place?

speaker: Lilith
text: Sounds great.  _Frasier slams the paper against the glass of Roz's booth.  It says, "You're FIRED!!" She holds up a manila folder on which is scribbled, "I'M UNION." Frasier seethes.  FADE OUT_ **THE RETURN OF THE MAGNIFICENT STERNIN**  _Scene Two -- Frasier's Apartment It's evening.  Frasier is setting the table for dinner.  Martin is standing next to him, Niles is on the couch._

speaker: Martin
text: In my day, when two people broke up you were mad, you were angry, you hated each other!  Whatever happened to the sanctity of divorce?

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you never liked Lilith.

speaker: Martin
text: She's weird.

speaker: Frasier
text: She is not weird.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, she's _weird._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe she's a little strange.

speaker: Martin
text: No, [_points to Niles_] _Maris_ is a little strange.  Lilith is

speaker: Niles
text: Gee whiz, Dad, I had no idea you preferred my wife to Frasier's.  _Daphne comes out of the kitchen holding a cold beer can to her forehead._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, my head!

speaker: Frasier
text: Can I get you an aspirin, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no, no, I'm afraid those are useless.  This is one of my psychic headaches.  There's some kind of negative force out there.  I only get these when there's a clawing at the cosmic continuum.  _She hands the beer to Martin and heads back to the kitchen. Niles gets up and hops over the coffee table._

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps if someone rubbed your temples--

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  I'm sure she wants privacy while she contacts the mother ship.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I must tell you, I'm here for support, but I will not speak to Lilith.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles, this ongoing feud between you and Lilith is ridiculous!  Let it go, it was years ago.

speaker: Martin
text: I can't even remember what the fight was about in the first place.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, let me refresh you!  At our wedding, while Maris was reciting her vows -- which she wrote herself -- vows of love from the heart, I distinctly heard snickering.  I glanced behind me and there was Lilith, her fingers pressed hard against her lips, her body shaking like a paint mixer.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, now, now, there she is.  All right, now -- now listen, it's just one evening out of your life.  Will you at least try to be civil?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, but I refuse to be warm.  _Frasier goes to the door, and glances back to make sure everything is O.K.  Niles and Martin are standing uncomfortably side by side.  Frasier opens the door.  There is Lilith, much as we remember her -- hair done up in a bun, pale complexion, and a conservative but elegant dress.  However, she is smiling, and maybe a little nervous._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking her purse and coat_] Here, let me take these things for you.  There we are.  Oh, look who's here.

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Martin.  Hello, Niles. **Niles & Martin: **[_flat, toneless_] Hello.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_looks around_] Where's Maris?

speaker: Niles
text: She's visiting her sister in Chicago.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh.  I thought perhaps she was sailing up the transplendent river of your love.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, I like what you've done with your apartment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lilith
text: You have beautiful things.

speaker: Frasier
text: The settlement is final, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Go away.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why does he listen to you, and not to me?

speaker: Lilith
text: By the tone of my voice, he senses I mean business.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I see.  You're saying your voice is more commanding than mine is?

speaker: Martin
text: Hell, I took a half a step before I realized she was talking to the dog.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, hello -- I've never had a throbbing like this!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, um, this is my ex-wife, Dr. Lilith Sternin.  Lilith, this is Daphne Moon, my dad's physical therapist.

speaker: Lilith
text: It's nice to meet you.

speaker: Daphne
text: An equal pleasure. [_turning back to Frasier; whispering_] When I shook hands with that woman, I lost all feeling in my arm!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I'm going to pop into your bedroom and use the phone.  Maris was developing some sniffles, I just want to make sure she's taking in enough liquids.

speaker: Lilith
text: Isn't it enough that she's eternally sipping from the font of your perpetual adoration?  _Lilith smirks again.  Niles turns around, with a "That does it!" expression.  Frasier signals him, "Not here!"  Niles exits._

speaker: Lilith
text: Martin, I'm especially delighted to see you here tonight.

speaker: Martin
text: [_gripping his cane a little closer_] Oh yeah?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh yes.  Knowing as I do the history of your relationship with Frasier, when I heard that he'd taken you in, I immediately flipped to the weather channel to see if hell had indeed frozen over.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, how'd you let ever this little peach get away?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I think dinner's just about ready.  Why don't we move to the table.  _Lilith and Martin get up and sit at the dinner table.  Niles also comes back and sits down._

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Lilith, how is Frederick?

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, as you know, I've enrolled him in that chess camp in the Berkshires.  It's really quite stimulating.  For eight hours a day, he sits in a large auditorium, with 300 other children, mastering the Alhausen-Grauve Opening.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, he's in the mountains.  Shouldn't he be out there in the fresh air?

speaker: Lilith
text: Every day after lunch they go for a nature walk. Unfortunately, Frederick is allergic to seven different varieties of ivy, so he has to wear long sleeves, and long pants... a bonnet with a net on it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Boy, I sure hope the other campers don't make fun of him.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I'm sure they don't.  You know how kind kids can be. Hell, all he needs is a birthmark on his forehead, and they'd beat him to death with a shovel! **LOOK WHAT I FOUND WITH THE DUST BUNNIES**  _Scene Three -- Frasier's Apartment After dinner, Martin is sitting in his armchair.  As Frasier and Niles watch, Lilith analyzes him.  Daphne is holding an icepack to her head._

speaker: Martin
text: So, I chased this guy down a dark alley, and when he got to the end he turned and pulled a knife on me.  So I gave him a couple of good shots with my nightstick.

speaker: Lilith
text: Fascinating.  I have to ask, were you at all aware of any repressed sexual urges while you were pummeling him so mercilessly?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but I didn't put 'em in the report.

speaker: Lilith
text: You're having some fun at my expense, aren't you?

speaker: Martin
text: Not much. [_gets up_] In fact, I'm going to bed.  Goodnight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight, Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, well, if you don't need me any longer, I think I'll be shuffling off as well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, goodnight.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Lilith_] It was a pleasure meeting you.  By the way, how many days will you be staying in Seattle?

speaker: Lilith
text: Just through the weekend.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, enjoy your stay. [_heads to her room_] I'll be dead by Saturday night, I know it!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I guess I'll say my goodbyes as well.  Goodnight, Frasier. [_ignores Lilith_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this is ridiculous!  Listen, Lilith, uh, Niles is upset because you snickered at Maris's wedding vows.

speaker: Lilith
text: I simply responded with the genuine spontaneous emotion I was feeling at the moment. [_Frasier motions her to try harder_] But, if Niles is not mature enough to accept that, if he is so pitifully insecure, if he is in such need of validation, then I guess for some sense of familial harmony, I do apologize.

speaker: Niles
text: [_overjoyed_] Oh, Lilith, thank you! [_hugs her tight_] Oh, this bad blood between us has gone on far too long!  Next time you're in town, we'll have dinner, just you and me!

speaker: Frasier
text: He doesn't get that kind of validation at home, you see.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it's just the two of us.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  It's the first time we've been alone together since the lawyers put us in that room and said, "Don't come out until there's some resolution."

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, well, this was nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes it was, wasn't it?

speaker: Lilith
text: You have a beautiful view.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's a beautiful city.  I hope you enjoy your convention.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, for God's sake, Frasier.  There is no convention.  I'm here because of the letter.

speaker: Frasier
text: The letter?  What letter?

speaker: Lilith
text: You know very well what letter.  The one you left in the apartment last month when you were home to visit Frederick, the one proposing we get back together.  Surely you didn't forget?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_reading_] "My darling, how could a love like ours have fallen so far from grace?  There must be some part of your heart that still resounds to the rhythm of my own.  I fear that I'll be lost without you.  As long as we have love, love will keep us together."  Aside from the shameless pilfering from the Captain and Tenille, I was moved by your entreaty.  I felt the same way, and yet I felt the need to create this pretense of arriving here for a convention, because I was still torn and unable to commit myself.  But seeing you now, I realize how much I've missed you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith, I did write that letter, and I did leave it in the apartment, but...

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: It wasn't last month.  It was nearly a year ago.  It's before I moved to Seattle.  You just found it now?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_deflated_] It had fallen behind the dresser.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I see the cleaning service is still doing its usual bang-up job.

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, don't I feel like the perfect fool?

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, Lilith--

speaker: Lilith
text: Here I am, humiliated, emotionally drained, and I've used up all my frequent flier miles!

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith, please!

speaker: Lilith
text: No, Frasier, please, there's nothing else to say.  I'd like to leave with at least a shred of dignity.  _She goes out the front door and closes it behind her.  Unfortunately, she closes it on her purse string, trapping her purse inside.  For a few moments, she pathetically tries to pull the purse up and through the crack in the door, then rings the bell.  Frasier opens the door._

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you.  _She leaves.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Niles are sitting at a corner table.  Frasier hands Niles the letter._

speaker: Frasier
text: I wrote this letter just before I came to Seattle hoping for a reconciliation.  She only just now found it.

speaker: Niles
text: Didn't the Captain and Tenille sing this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Like they own those five words!  You know, I-I got over her, I moved out here.  She comes back and I wonder if I made the right decision.  I did write that letter.

speaker: Niles
text: It appears you have come to some sort of a crossroads.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's a nice tidy little way of saying I'm in hell. Niles, I have a life here that suits me, and yet I can't help wondering if there is still some chance for reconciliation, if it's worth exploring the feelings that--that I'm feeling.  Do you think I should see her again tonight?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, like most patients who come to a therapist, you already know the answer to the question you're posing.  You just want me to agree with your decision and support you whether I share your opinion or not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but I don't have an opinion in this case.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sure you do.

speaker: Frasier
text: But I don't.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, then I can't help you.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, all right.  I think in my soul, I'm leaning toward taking the next step and, uh, seeing if there's anything... there.

speaker: Niles
text: That is what you should do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?

speaker: Niles
text: You know why.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn it, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you know why.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.  We have a long history together, we-we have a son that we both adore.  There were some good times, and when they were good... Hoo-ah!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it seems our minds are pretty well made up, aren't they?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they are.  Thank you, Niles.  I don't know what I'd do without you.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, you do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Drop it! _FADE TO:  Scene Five -- Lilith's Hotel Room Lilith is waiting in her hotel room.  She's dressed in a short skirt and a nice jacket.  Her hair, unusually, is let down.  Frasier knocks on the door, and she opens it._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: I must be early, I see you haven't had a chance to put up your hair yet.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, I thought I'd leave it down tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_surprised_] Really?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, after several hours of careful deliberation, and weighing all the consequences, I decided to be playful.  I'm glad you invited me to dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how could I not?  I felt so awful about last night. You see, I just thought you'd read the letter long ago and ignored it.

speaker: Lilith
text: No explanation necessary.  It was a simple misunderstanding.

speaker: Frasier
text: O.K.  Well, I know a great little French bistro just around the corner--

speaker: Lilith
text: Uh, Frasier?  Before we go anywhere, I would just like to go on record as saying that, regardless of everything that's happened, I respect you for getting on with your life as successfully as you have.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'd like to say that I feel the same way about you. Frederick is flourishing, and I'm sure that's in no small part due to you.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_touched_] Oh, thank you.  That means a great deal to me.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_helping her into her coat_] Geez, do you realize that's the first pleasant thing we've said to each other in almost a year?

speaker: Lilith
text: You're right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_stops_] You know, I'm suddenly quite moved.

speaker: Lilith
text: I am too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would it be a dreadful contretemps if I kissed you right now?

speaker: Lilith
text: You can always try.  _She turns around, and puts her arms around his neck.  They kiss. As the kiss gets deeper, he drops her coat to the floor._

speaker: Frasier
text: You want to bag dinner?

speaker: Lilith
text: There's a bed and an honor bar, what more do we need?

speaker: Frasier
text: Come to me, my white-hot flame!

speaker: Lilith
text: I was insane to divorce you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, you're in my thoughts every waking hour!

speaker: Lilith
text: You're the only man I've ever loved!

speaker: Frasier
text: So are you!   **FRIED EGGS AND OTHER SMALL TRAGEDIES**  _Scene Six -- Lilith's Hotel Room Frasier and Lilith lie beside each other in bed.  Frasier wakes up first, and his eyes widen with alarm as he realizes what happened. He starts to quietly slide out of bed -- then Lilith wakes up and sleepily rolls onto him, smiling._

speaker: Lilith
text: Good morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Jolly good morning to you, too.

speaker: Lilith
text: I could stay like this all morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Me, too. [_checks his watch_]

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm so glad I decided to take the chance and fly out here to be with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, me too, me too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'll get that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Must be the breakfast we ordered last night.  Boy, I am famished!

speaker: Lilith
text: You should be.  You were a busy boy.  _Frasier smiles, then smoothes his hair and opens the door. A room service waiter comes in with a breakfast cart._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi. Waiter: Good morning, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just bring it right in here, please.  Uh, that's fine. [_tips the waiter_] Little something for you, too.  Thank you, good day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, boy, it's funny how life takes it's little turns, isn't it?  Yesterday morning when I woke up, I never imagined I'd be waking up here this morning.

speaker: Lilith
text: Indeed.

speaker: Frasier
text: And -- I mean, it's not that we were overly impulsive or anything, or that what we did was wrong, I just--

speaker: Lilith
text: This is a mistake.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thank God you said that!  Oh, it's not that last night wasn't very enjoyable, but who are we kidding?  You've gotten on with your life, I've gotten on with mine!  I've got a new career, I've reestablished relationships with my family, I've got a whole new set of friends -- for the first time in years, I'm happy!  I mean, for us to even consider getting back together -- it's just the stupidest thing two people could do!

speaker: Lilith
text: [_staring at him with horror_] I meant the eggs.  I ordered poached, not fried.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_trying to cover_] Well, you didn't let me finish, you see... after I played Devil's advocate, I--

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, Frasier, don't insult me!  That's how you really feel, isn't it?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lilith, are you crying?  God, I'm sorry.  Once again, I've led you down an emotional primrose path.  Lilith, I never meant to hurt you.  I don't blame you if you're mad at me.

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm not mad at you, I'm mad at me.  I don't even know what I'm doing here!  I've just been so lonely over the last year, and when I found your letter, it was -- it was like a life preserver!  I'm raising a child alone.  I'm scared.  I always thought of myself as a strong and independent person, but the truth is, I'm afraid.  I guess that's why I convinced myself that I was still in love with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean you're not?

speaker: Lilith
text: No, I'm not.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's good.  So then what happened last night was only because you were lonely, and I was--

speaker: Lilith
text: We all know what you were, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Lilith, Lilith, here, here, come with me here. [_guides her to the mirror_] Now, listen, look in there, tell me what you see. [_she can't say anything_] All right, I'll tell you what I see.  I see the same strong-willed, dynamic, intelligent woman I married seven years ago.  Listen, you're just suffering a temporary lapse -- divorce does that to you. [_turns her around to face him_] Listen, I won't say anything as trite as "someday you'll find someone."  But I know this: I know you, and I know that no matter what the future holds in store for you, you'll handle it.

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: You hungry?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yeah.

speaker: Frasier
text: O.K.  _Frasier goes to the cart and starts setting places at the coffee table._

speaker: Lilith
text: You always knew how to buck me up when I was blue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, well, you know you helped me through some hard times yourself.

speaker: Lilith
text: You know, those married years weren't all bad.  We did have some good moments.

speaker: Frasier
text: The best one was Frederick. [_he takes her hand_] We'll always have that.

speaker: Frasier
text: And, you know, I can't help telling you this.  Even though we're not in love anymore, you were always the most exciting lover I ever had.  I think in your heart of hearts that you'd say the same about me.

speaker: Lilith
text: They screwed up the toast, too, I ordered rye.

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith?  _She gives him a sly look that helps us understand why he fell for her in the first place.  They start to eat breakfast._
